text.section:
The sum of the concentration levels of lead, cadmium, mercury, and hexavalent chromium incidentally present in a package or packaging component may not exceed:
By July 1, 1993, 600 parts per million by weight or 0.06%;
By July 1, 1994, 250 parts per million by weight or 0.025%; and
By July 1, 1995, 100 parts per million by weight or 0.01%.
Tin plated steel that meets the American Society for Testing and Materials Specification A-623 shall be considered a single packaging component.
